extendedIngredients.name: chicken
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound BAREÂ® Chicken's fresh boneless, skinless chicken breast fillets, cut crosswise in half

extendedIngredients.name: kosher salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

extendedIngredients.name: lemon zest
extendedIngredients.originalString: Zest of 2 lemons, plus more, for garnish

recipes.title: Easy Lemon Chicken

winePairing.pairingText: Chicken works really well with Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. You could try Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 27 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Selected from three of California's most recognized Chardonnay appellations, Sonoma, Monterey and Napa, our Ghost Pines Chardonnay offers expressive, fruit-forward characteristics. The artful combination of these three regions delivers baked apple, pear and lemon cream flavors, accented by an elegant finish of sweet vanilla.

recipes.instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. In a large bowl, combine bread crumbs and lemon zest; set aside. Season chicken with salt and pepper, to taste. Working one at a time, dredge chicken in flour, dip into eggs, then dredge in bread crumbs mixture, pressing to coat. Working in batches, add chicken to the skillet, 2 or 3 at a time, and cook until evenly golden and crispy, about 3-4 minutes on each side. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate. Serve immediately, garnished with lemon zest, if desired.

steps.step: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. In a large bowl, combine bread crumbs and lemon zest; set aside. Season chicken with salt and pepper, to taste. Working one at a time, dredge chicken in flour, dip into eggs, then dredge in bread crumbs mixture, pressing to coat. Working in batches, add chicken to the skillet, 2 or 3 at a time, and cook until evenly golden and crispy, about 3-4 minutes on each side.
Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.
Serve immediately, garnished with lemon zest, if desired.
